meanings.definition: To cross one another, as lines.
meanings.sent1: The roads intercrossed in the middle of the town.
meanings.sent2: The branches of the trees intercrossed in a beautiful pattern.
meanings.sent3: The knitting needles intercrossed like dancers on a stage.
meanings.sent4: The paths of fate intercrossed, leading them to unexpected destinations.
meanings.sent5: The rivers intercrossed, creating a mesmerizing network of waterways.

meanings.definition: To breed by crossing different varieties or breeds.
meanings.sent1: The farmer intercrossed the cows to improve the herd.
meanings.sent2: The breeder intercrossed the dogs to create a new hybrid breed.
meanings.sent3: The rabbits intercrossed in the garden, much to the amusement of the children.
meanings.sent4: The ideas intercrossed in his mind, giving birth to a brilliant solution.
meanings.sent5: The colors intercrossed on the canvas, forming a unique masterpiece.
